Aesop a comedy as it is acted at the Theatre-Royal in Drury-Lane. Vanbrugh, John, Sir, 1664-1726. Boursault, M. (Edme), 1638-1701. Fables d'Esope.
The second edition, with the addition of a second part.
[4], 58, 16 p.
Printed for Thomas Bennet, London : 1697.
A translation and adaptation of Boursault's "Les fables d'Esope" and "Esope à la cour". Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

The second edition, with the addition of a second part.
[4], 58, 16 p.
Printed for Thomas Bennet, London : 1697.
A translation and adaptation of Boursault's "Les fables d'Esope" and "Esope à la cour". Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
